column4: hello, I just did a clean ubuntu install, can someone give me this package name for all this java stuff
It needs to be Java Development Kid x64
did you enable the partner repositories?
when synaptic is opened  click "Settings  / Repositories"
go to the "Other software"  tab  and tick both partner repositories
close that  Reload... first   hit "Search"  then type in icedtead.... mark ALL of the ones listed as installed   to "REMOVE COMPLETELY"
then hit Search again  and type   sun java   scroll down for the sun-java6  packages
tick the ones you want  including the sun-java6-plugin
did you check all of that I just posted?
ok and did the sun java6  packages show up in the list?

that is going to be dependent on if the applications and needs you have work with icedtea....they dont here  so I never use icedtea  because most of the java application I have or my clients have require sun java
there are alternatives  Pinta  comes to mind...also imagemagick
Pinta  is simple enough but has default plugins ...not too dissimilar to a low end photoshop
